be.uclouvain.mlg.jForest.splitting

Class Splitter

  • java.lang.Object
    • be.uclouvain.mlg.jForest.splitting.Splitter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Binary1FeatureSplitter

    public abstract class Splitter
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is an abstract implementation of splitter objects that are used at each node to find the best split and then apply it to data

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(Tree tree)
        Initializes the current object which is created using the default constructor
        Parameters:
        tree - The split is operated in the root node of tree

      • findBestSplit

        public abstract void findBestSplit()
        Learn the best split.
        Preconditions:
        The current object must be initialized with init(Tree tree) before calling this method.
        Postconditions:
        When the call returns, the current object knows
        • the best variable used for splitting
        • the number of children
        • the way to allocate a child for a given sample
        • the importance index of the split

      • getChildIdFor

        public int getChildIdFor(double[] sampleFeatures)
        Parameters:
        sampleFeatures - is the full vector of a data point
        Returns:
        the id in [0 ; this.getNbChildren()[ of the child in which the training sample falls into
        Preconditions:
        findBestSplit() was previously called on the current object

      • getChildIdFor

        public int getChildIdFor(int trainingSampleId)
        Parameters:
        trainingSampleId - index of a sample in d
        Returns:
        the index in [0 ; this.getNbChildren()[ of the child in which training sample trainingSampleId falls into
        Preconditions:
        findBestSplit() was previously called on the current object

      • getRepartition

        public int[][] getRepartition()
        Computes the repartition of samples in subtrees. This is implemented with memoization.
        Returns:
        res[i][] is an array containing indices of samples falling into the i-th subtree
        Preconditions:
        findBestSplit() was previously called on the current object

      • getNbChildren

        public int getNbChildren()
        Returns:
        the number of children in which samples will fall into according to the current split
        Preconditions:
        findBestSplit() was previously called on the current object

      • getImportanceIndex

        public double getImportanceIndex()
        Returns:
        the importance index of the current split
        Preconditions:
        findBestSplit() was previously called on the current object

      • getVariableUsedToSplit

        public int[] getVariableUsedToSplit()
        Returns:
        the index of the variables used to make the split
        Preconditions:
        findBestSplit() was previously called on the current object
